2018 Summer School on Structural Dynamic Models

QuantEcon will run a one-day workshop at the Summer School on Structural Dynamic Models, to be held on May 28th 2018 at the University of Copenhagen. The sessions will provide an overview of modern open source tools and techniques for computational modeling, loosely based on the material in Lectures in Quantitative Economics.

Schedule

  • 9:00 - 10:30: Introduction to QuantEcon, Jupyter notebooks, and Python
  • 10:45 - 12:15: Python for data handling, analysis, and visualisation, numerical techniques
  • 12:15 - 13:15: Lunch
  • 13:15 - 14:45: Intro to Numba
  • 15:00 - 16:30: Dynamic programming applications with Numba and parallelization
  • 16:45 - 18:15: Computer lab/office hours

For the full summer school schedule, please see this page.

Location

Department of Economics, University of Copenhagen

Instructions

Please be sure to bring your laptop to the workshop.  If possible,

  • Install Anaconda Python following the instructions on this page

All languages and computing platforms we use are free and open source.  

Troubleshooting of installations and other software issues will be available in the first session.

Resources

The following resources will be useful during and after:

  • GitHub repo
  • Lectures in Quantitative Economics
  • Cheatsheets

Presenters

John Stachurski, Natasha Watkins

Contact

For requests or feedback, please email contact@quantecon.org.

A NumFocus Fiscally Sponsored Project.
